summary: This is a declaration by Denise Johannes, Director of Corporations & Trademarks for the Office of the Lieutenant Governor of the U.S. Virgin Islands, certifying compliance with a grand jury subpoena dated August 7, 2019, for business records. It establishes the authenticity and business record status of documents being provided in response to the subpoena.

persons.role: Director of Corporations & Trademarks, Custodian of Records
persons.context: Declarant and custodian of records for the Office of the Lieutenant Governor in the U.S. Virgin Islands, who certifies the authenticity of business records provided in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated August 7, 2019, requesting specified business records.

connections.description: Johannes, as custodian of records, is responding to and certifying compliance with a subpoena issued by the Assistant U.S. Attorney.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by an Assistant United States Attorney, requesting specified business records.

events.title: Declaration of Custodian Executed
events.description: Denise Johannes executed this declaration under penalty of perjury, certifying the authenticity of business records provided in response to the subpoena.

locations: 5049 Kongens Gade, St. Thomas, VI 00802 (Office of the Lieutenant Governor, U.S. Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 7, 2019, by an Assistant U.S. Attorney, as part of an ongoing investigation.
Denise Johannes, as the custodian of records for the Office of the Lieutenant Governor of the U.S. Virgin Islands, certified the provided business records as authentic.
The document is a formal declaration under penalty of perjury, establishing the records' admissibility under Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 803(6).
The subpoena targeted business records, indicating investigators were seeking corporate or official documentation from the U.S. Virgin Islands government.
The location of the records custodian is in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, a jurisdiction relevant to Epstein's properties and activities.
